thread.title: Beacon field hockey shuts out Delmar 4-0
thread.title_full: Beacon field hockey shuts out Delmar 4-0

author: newsroom@capegazette.com (Dave Frederick )
title: Beacon field hockey shuts out Delmar 4-0
text:
Beacon field hockey shuts out Delmar 4-0 Middle school soccer and volleyball also tally wins By Dave Frederick | Oct 08, 2015 Photo by: Dave Frederick Beacon hockey is a perennial powerhouse program under coach Patti Jo Mock. 
The Beacon field hockey team defeated Delmar Oct. 5 at home 4-0 to remain unbeaten and unscored-upon in their three wins this young season. 
Beacon was paced in scoring on goals by Lola Messick 2, Paige Ludwicki and Noelle Sabbagh. Ludwicki, Abigail Kane and Ryleigh Elliot each had an assist. 
Goaltending duties were split between Marlee Geppert and Autumn Davis. 
Beacon was scheduled to play at Georgetown Wednesday, Oct 7. 
The Beacon soccer team defeated Delmar 7-2 on goals by Ilarion Swallow 2, Jakob Gelof, Hunter Simmons, Lucas Johnson, Eid Nouhra and Nick Jones. Beacon improved to 2-0-1 on the season. 
Beacon saves were by goalies Nathan Louks and Wyatt Simpler 5. 
The Beacon volleyball team defeated Dover Central Oct. 2 2-1 to improve to 3-0-1 on the season. Paige Ludwicki pushes the ball toward the goal. (Photo by: Dave Frederick ) Anna Stancofski patrols the midfield. (Photo by: Dave Frederick )
